programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Fire
programme.desc: The melting pot extreme, traditional American BBQ meets ethnic grilling.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Fire
programme.desc: Steven shows grilling from whole fish to shellfish.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Oaxaca, Mexico: Chef Tony Bourdain explores the exotic and colorful indigenous zone of Mexico's Oaxaca region where he tastes toasted grasshoppers and other delicacies. His adventure ends with mariachi music and, of course, lots of tequila.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Morocco (Cities): Tony is invited to experience the culinary heart and distinct walled medinas (districts) of the Moroccan city Fes.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Jumping into a Thai tuk tuk taxi, Tony attempts to soak up Thai culture, and get lost in the cuisine of Chiang Mai, Thailand.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Tony embarks on a pilgrimage to Sydney, Australia so he may indulge in a meal made by one of the world's best chefs - Tetsuya Wakuda.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Portugal: Portuguese cuisine holds a dear place in Tony's culinary heart. Tony travels to Porto, home of the famous Port wine, where he is immediately exposed to the codfish and the almost mythical place it holds in Portuguese cuisine and culture.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: San Sebastian: A Food Lover's Town
programme.desc: San Sebastian, Spain: Tony explores the food-crazed Basque culture. Tony's guide, Chef Luis Irizar, takes Tony into the underworld of Basque gastronomic societies. Later, Tony explores the city's tapas bars.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Did you know that the humble little meatball has a starring role in the Mexican kitchen? Explore traditional versions of albondingas in the old-school Bar Mancera, as well as modern versions in hipster haven Cicatriz, with Rick Bayless.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Join Rick and winemaker Hugo d'Acosta as they toast the world-class wines of Baja California Norte. Hugo first introduces Rick his Casa de Piedra wines before moving on to Tres Mujeres, L.A. Cetto, and the San Rafael Winery.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: "Eat your veggies" is a line that children from Mexico to Morocco hear from their parents. Meet a pair of chefs, Israel Montero and Alfredo Chaves of Kaah Siis Restaurant, who grow, cook, and consume their own garden-fresh vegetables.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: We find Rick and his daughter, Lanie, at Mexico City's colorful Sonora Market, an emporium of medicinal herbs and the best place to buy cazuelas. They also check out El Guero, an institution in Mexico City popularly known as "Tacos Hola!"

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Rick heads for Jalisco, the place where mariachi music originated, to investigate the history and mystery of this "national soundtrack" of Mexico.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.sub-title: Off the Beaten Path in Huatulco
programme.desc: Mexico's beaches glimmer with pristine perfection. Chef Rick Bayless takes us off the beaten path to find great food and even better beaches such as Playa Chahue and Playa Principal. You would be well-advised to follow his lead.

programme.title: Rituals of the World
programme.desc: In the heart of the Amazon rainforest of Brazil, the Satere-Mawe people have a rite of passage leading to adulthood where a feat of bravery turns boys into men. According to tribe members, this painful initiation prepares young men for life and proves they can fulfill their reproductive obligations.

programme.title: Recreating Eden
programme.desc: Upon walking in the maple forest that is now a part of Blueroof Farm, Kim Ondaatje knew she had found her home. Our "wilderness gardens," as she calls them, help strengthen our bond with the Earth, with other people, and with our souls.

programme.title: Recreating Eden
programme.desc: People wondered why Jane and Barry left Vancouver for Panama. For them, it was about Time. In Panama, the couple works more, but it is work that is more satisfactory to them, and together they consider themselves stewards of the land.

programme.title: National Parks Revealed
programme.desc: Bask in luxurious getaways and rustic retreats that are almost as celebrated as the wondrous landscapes that surround them. The Old Faithful Inn in Yellowstone National Park, and the natural springs at the Furnace Creek Inn in Death Valley National Park are just two of the treasures you will visit.

programme.title: National Parks Revealed
programme.sub-title: National Parks of the Great Southwest
programme.desc: From Canyonlands and Arches to Saguaro and Death Valley, the wonders of the American Southwest spread across extreme lands of astonishing beauty. Climb the face of a monolith millions of years in the making, seek out a sunrise horseback ride through cactus country, and much more.

programme.title: Lonely Planet: Best Parks Ever - America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: Best Parks You've Never Heard of
programme.desc: See where astronauts trained for moon missions and dive miles deep into crystal caves in the best parks that you've never heard of.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: Washington, DC, restaurateur Daisuke Utagawa and travel journalist Rudy Max deliver viewers directly to Bangkok's sprawling city temples, its huge flower market, its vibrant klongs (canals), and to its most interesting cuisine, all of which made Bangkok the world's most-visited city by travelers.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: Rudy Maxa and Daisuke Utagawa take us to the heart of Japan in Tokyo where culinary geniuses strive for perfection as they prepare everything from sushi to the wasabi.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: In one of his series' most colorful episodes, Maxa takes viewers along the Silk Road in a country that is an emerging economy in Central Asia, Uzbekistan. Marvel at eye-popping mosques built centuries ago, and Rudy joins a family for the preparation of the national dish of "plov."

programme.title: Rick Steves' Iran: Yesterday and Today
programme.desc: This special explores the country's rich history, culture, and warm hospitality.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Rick Steves: We'll visit Italy's five tiny seaside towns known as the Cinque Terre, while stopping to fish for anchovies, sip wine from barrels, and savor twinkling Mediterranean vistas.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: We'll connect with the culture and art of Norway's proud capital city - from once-fearsome Viking ships to its sleek Opera House, and from tales of World War II heroes to the constant festival of its thriving waterfront.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: We'll explore the palace of Maria Theresa and be dazzled by the crown jewels.

programme.title: WaterVoyagers - Chinese Adventures
programme.desc: Join the team as they visit ancient temples and awe-inspiring caverns.

programme.title: Discovering the World
programme.desc: Almost everything is an excuse to celebrate in Ibiza. Ibizan's celebrate on the beach, on boats, and in villas. Locals also celebrate traditional feasts in their villages. Witness an island rich in ancient history, one encircled by creeks, cliffs, and yellow sandy beaches, and visit Formentera.

programme.title: Rituals of the World
programme.desc: Simply put, "Ukuli Bula" is a bull jumping ceremony. The idea for those who participate is to perform three consecutive jumps over three large bulls, without falling over. If the young man, or "Ukuli," fails in his endeavor, he will be mocked by the village, and will not be allowed to marry.

programme.title: Secrets of the National Parks
programme.desc: Discover the secrets of the Southwest along famous Route 66 and the Grand Circle, an area concentrated with national parks. Discover how Monument Valley in Utah and Gallup in New Mexico became cinematic locations, jet-ski in Lake Powell, and explore the spirit of the Navajo in Canyon de Chelly.

programme.title: Lonely Planet: Best Parks Ever - America's National Parks
programme.desc: If you like your nature a little weird, then this is the show for you. See all the freaks of nature in the best parks ever.

programme.title: Canada's National Parks
programme.desc: Explore a region famed for its hot springs, backcountry treks, and fantastic array of wildlife, and be treated to elegant dining, and chateaux retreats. Also, enjoy train rides aboard the Rocky Mountaineer, scenic drives along the Continental Divide, and Snocoach rides across treacherous ice fields.

programme.title: Bare Feet with Mickela Mallozzi
programme.desc: Montreal's diverse history translates into the city's unique traditional dances, exemplified by the La Grande Rencontre Festival. Also, experience Montreal's artistic modernity, and take part in a dance lesson for people with disabilities.

programme.title: Bare Feet with Mickela Mallozzi
programme.desc: Mickela celebrates the annual St. Nicholas feast with the Greek-American community in Queens, while also finding time to shine a light on the local heroes who keep Greek culture alive in New York.

programme.title: Big Little Footprints
programme.desc: If the Atlantis Bahamas isn’t on your family's bucket list - it should be!

programme.title: Big Little Footprints
programme.desc: We remind viewers just how much you can find when exploring your own backyard.

programme.title: My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas
programme.desc: Laconia is known for kalamata olives. Diane follows the famous olive from harvest to table, and then whips up a feast befitting the remarkable fruit, including Spartan Chicken. Discover how olives can transform any meal into a masterpiece.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Smoke
programme.desc: Don't wait for Thanksgiving to try these twists on holiday favorites.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Smoke
programme.sub-title: You Can Smoke What? Extreme Smoking
programme.desc: Learn to smoke foods you never thought you could like Camembert cheese.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Smoke
programme.desc: Make gourmet treats like mesquite-smoked oysters and 7-bone prime rib.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Smoke
programme.sub-title: How to Smoke When You Don't Have a Smoker
programme.desc: This show is for those who want to smoke indoors without a traditional smoker.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Smoke
programme.desc: Learn to use a wood-burning rotisserie for pork loin and pork shoulder.
